timeline.bodyText:
This change is due to the unfortunate reality of pleasing code coverage. A way was required to (platform independently) test for a failure scenario. The previous solution had several problems which made this difficult:

The visibility of cleanupDirectories and other BookKeeperServiceRunner fields made it hard to unit test cleanupDirectories at all in the first place (without affecting the state of the service, and therefore other tests).
Unit testing cleanupDirectories within any other the BookKeeper* tests seems very forced and unnatural.
Forcing an IOException to be thrown (across platforms) is also quite difficult -- it is much easier to force an IllegalArgumentException.
We still need some way to determine whether or not an exception was thrown. Previously the exception was only caught and logged.

At the expensive of creating two small classes, this avoids the above problems.
